physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Height: 175 cm, Weight: 90.7 kg. Mild distress due to pain in the left shoulder and posterior scapular area during active and passive motion; range of motion was restricted above horizontal position. Tenderness to palpation over the spine of the left scapula; normal sensation, strength, pulses in arms and legs.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Two days later, white-cell count was 15,800 per cubic millimeter and C-reactive protein was 19 mg per liter, indicating mild improvement in lab findings. Six days later, the patient was readmitted with milder erythema surrounding surgical incision, clean and dry with sutures in place, though the remainder of the examination was unchanged.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Corncectional exam indicates a white-cell count of 15,000 per cubic millimeter; normal differential count.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up visit indicated increased scapular pain; radiograph showed a lytic lesion with associated fracture.

physical_examinations.date: At follow-up visit (3 months after discharge)
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up CT study showed almost complete resolution of previously seen nodules and cysts; healing of the left scapula fracture noted.
